Column Comment.0: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.3: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.4: HSE INCIDENT CLASS: Use this table to broadly classify the type of incident, usuallyin reporting terms. The detailed types of incidents are linked to the details, as variouscomponents of the incident may be classified differently.
Column Comment.5: INCIDENT DATE: The date on which the incident occurred, or if it spans multipledates, the date when it started.
Column Comment.6: INCIDENT DURATION: The length of time that the incident continued. Usuallymeasured in a time period, such as minutes, hours, seconds or days.
Column Comment.9: LOST TIME INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether lost time occurred because ofthis incident.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: RECORDED TIME: The time at which this condition was recorded.
Column Comment.12: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: REPORTED BY BA ID: the identifier for the Business associate who is reported thisincident.
Column Comment.15: REPORTED BY NAME: The name or initials of the person who reported this incident.
Column Comment.16: REPORTED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this incident was reported.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: WORK RELATED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this incident was workrelated.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
